name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: Doris Miller should have received the Medal of Honor. He put his life on the line for a country that treated him like a second-class citizen. We can, and we must correct this injustice by awarding him the Medal of Honor posthumously.

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: In January of 2020, the Secretary of the Navy announced the naming of a future aircraft carrier in his honor‚Äîthe U.S.S Doris Miller (CVN-81). It is the first aircraft carrier named for an enlisted sailor and African American. This was a massive step forward, but it is not enough. https://t.co/kbc2Q6GHUT

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: Two years later, Doris Miller was aboard on the U.S.S. Liscome Bay when it was struck by a torpedo off the coast of Butaritari Island in the Western Pacific. He and over 600 other sailors onboard the ship were presumed dead and their bodies were never recovered.

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: But when the time came for official recognition, Miller, who was listed as an ‚Äúunnamed Negro,‚Äù received only a letter of commendation while 15 of his shipmates received the Medal of Honor. It wasn‚Äôt until the NAACP requested proper recognition that he was awarded the Navy Cross. https://t.co/G9WgS9GkXG

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: Per the U.S.S. West Virginia‚Äôs action report, Miller was ‚Äúinstrumental in hauling people along through oil and water to the quarterdeck, thereby unquestionably saving the lives of a number of people who might otherwise have been lost.‚Äù

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: When the attack began, he immediately left his post in the laundry room to rescue shipmates injured in the initial barrage and to defend the harbor. He is credited for manning an anti-aircraft gun, for which he had no training, and providing cover fire until ordered off the ship. https://t.co/PAbwaHjJ30

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: Doris Miller was born in Waco, Texas in 1919. After high school, he enlisted in the Navy as a mess attendant‚Äîone of the few positions available for Black sailors. He was assigned to the U.S.S. West Virginia, which was stationed at Pearl Harbor the morning of December 7th, 1941.

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text:
Today marks the 80th anniversary of the attack on Pearl Harbor. More than 2,400 lives were lost, and our nation was forever changed.

Many heroes were made on that fateful day, but let me tell you the story of one you may not have heard of before‚ÄîDoris Miller. https://t.co/Ft02FATh1v

tweet_text: @JeffFortenberry This bipartisan bill would require all hotels and places of short-term lodging to advertise a price that includes all mandatory fees. This applies to online travel agents and short-term rental sites as well. #EndHiddenFees

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: This deceptive practice is unfair to consumers and should have stopped a long time ago. Today, we take a step forward towards ending these fees. I am proud to introduce the Hotel Advertising Transparency Act with my colleague @JeffFortenberry #EndHiddenFees

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: For over 20 years, hotels and other short-term lodging operators have gotten away with advertising prices that don't include hidden fees such as resort fees, cleaning fees, or facility fees. This industry has brought in over $30 billion thanks to this practice. #EndHiddenFees

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: #BosnianWomensDay has come to an end.  It was a powerful reminder of the importance of #Genocide #Prevention

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: .@EliKula: "A lot of the youth want to leave #Bosnia. Brain drain is a problem." #BosnianWomensDay

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: .@EliKula: "Children in #Bosnia are willing to listen, but not yet to totally accept the truth about the #bosniawar

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: .@EliKula: "#Syria should involve more women in the reconciliation process than Bosnia did." #BosnianWomensDay

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: Advice for the aftermath of the war in #Syria from Murina: "Do not divide the country into enclaves after the war." #BosnianWomensDay

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: .@EliKuna: "Ask our politicians to agree to deals that include long-term goals, and we must work with locals." #BosnianWomensDay

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: .@EliKuna: "Politicians will always use nationalist rhetoric when trying to get elected, but education is key for reconciliation."

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: .@EliKuna: "Our children are learning three different versions of history, and that focus in education in #bosnia is what we need most."

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: .@EliKuna: "I do not think that we yet have embarked on reconciliation...what we do need is education."

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: Murina: "No one in Bosnia is working on trust." #BosnianWomensDay

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: Answer from Murina: "Not as long as politicians and public figures keep making public statements denying what happened."

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: Q1: "Given the amount of #GenocideDenial in Bosnia and Herzegovina, what will it take to have reconciliation?" #BosnianWomensDay

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: I remember the conversation I had with @EliKula that created #BosnianWomensDay, and with it, a space to talk about #genocide #prevention

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: .@EliKula: "We have a serious problem processing war crimes in Bosnia and Herzegovina." #BosnianWomensDay

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: .@EliKula: "We cannot expect victims of the #genocide to be the first people to reach out for the reconciliation process."

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: .@EliKula: "As long as we hold on to the past and teach people about it, we can embrace it and move forward."

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: .@EliKula begins her words

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: Mu Di is a refugee who sits on the Dallas Youth Commission to advise Dallas‚Äô City Council on her experience #WWWP https://t.co/eE81RLTEBc

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
tweet_text: Munira: "Every victim deserves to be properly buried." #BosnianWomensDay

name: Rep. Eddie Bernice Johnson
